resources.string: Here you\'ll have the choice to choose between 3, 4, 5, or 8 dices to throw. Next you\'ll have to fill in how many iceholes, polarbears and penguins you see.

A Icehole is the middle eye of a dice, the polarbears are the eyes around the icehole. Only around a icehole will there be polarbears! Is there no icehole then there\'s no polarbear. The penguins are the eyes at the back of the dice.
The front and back of a dice are always 7 eyes.

In the northpole live the polarbears. To survive polarbears need to eat, they eat fish mostly. In the northpole area is a lot of ice. The polarbears find their fish at open water, the icehole. \n \n Because of too much ice at the northpole it\'s hard for polarbears to catch fish.
The game needs to be played with multiple dices (3 - 8 dices). With every throw the iceholes and polarbears need to be guessed by counting.
A harder difficulty of the game is playing with penguins, which if you turn this on also needs to be guessed. This is for the pro players.
On basis of multiple tries, you\'ll get to shown a hint screen, when you finish a level you\'ll get a reward and can even share it on Facebook.
Made by: Robin Tatlici, Firdhan Yahya, James Morsink
